RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 1 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 97. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 28900. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR PENNSYLVANIA BRED OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-win ners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since November 22 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since October 22 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $25,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CRAZY LEGS HIRSCH was off slowly, then moved up between rivals on the first turn to chase the early pace, then tracked the front runner on the tu rn and made a two wide bid and took over off the turn and kicked clear to prove best under crop urging. SITTIN ON GO set the early pace while clear on the inside, headed nearing the quarter pole, then proved to be no match for the winner while saving the place award. MIDNIGHT ACT was rated four to three wide, made a three wide bid off the turn but needed more late, held show award. REDEEM EDDIE was reserved early three wide, made a four wide bid leaving the quarter pole but flattened out. WISH FOR PEACE was reserved early on the inside, eased out on the turn and came five wide off the turn and had no significant rally. STRAWBERRY TREAT chased the pace on the inside and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Wish for Peace
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved inside, eased out turn, came 5 wide, no rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Strawberry Treat
ENTRY.OWNER: Z and Z Stables and Barrett Judith M
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace inside, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Sittin On Go
ENTRY.COMMENT: set unchallenged pace inside, headed 1/4, no match, held 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Crazy Legs Hirsch
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slowly, between 1st turn, chased, bid 2 wide, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Midnight Act
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated 4-3 wide, 3 wide 1/4 pole, bid upper stretch, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Redeem Eddie
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved 3 wide, 4 wide 1/4 pole, bid 4 wide, flattened out,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 2 6F Dirt CR: 84. Claiming Purse 19000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 22 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since October 22 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, if for $9,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Whe re Entered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GRAB THE GOLD prompted the pace three wide, made a three wide bid on the turn to be clear by the quarter pole, then was headed by the furlong marker and dug in gamely to hold on to prove best under a stiff drive. JUMPMASTER was rated on the outside early, made a four wide move on the turn to loom boldly, then got to even terms by the furlong marker but hung, clearly second best. BOURBON CURRENCY chased the early pace in between rivals, two wide by the quarter pole but lacked the needed closing bid while besting the rest. SHANGHAI CANDY was reserved early, three wide by the quarter pole, swung out five wide leaving the turn and had no rally. MARTINKELLY tracked the pace from the inside and weakened. THE ILLUSIONIST set the pace on the inside and was headed on the turn and gave way.

ENTRY.NAME: Martinkelly
ENTRY.OWNER: Two Ten Twelve Triple T Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace inside, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: The Illusionist
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace inside, headed turn, gave way,

ENTRY.NAME: Bourbon Currency
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace between horses, 2 wide 1/4, needed closing bid

ENTRY.NAME: Jumpmaster
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated outside, 4 wide move, hung

ENTRY.NAME: Shanghai Candy
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved early, 3 wide 1/4 pole, swung 5 wide, no rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Grab the Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted pace 3 wide, bid 3 wide, clear 1/4, dug in gamely, held

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 3 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 77. Claiming Purse 11800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 22 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since October 22 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DR RAGS prompted the early pace from the outside, then went up to press the pace on the turn and made a four wide bid off the turn, then had a long drive and edged clear to prove best, driving. FREEDOM'S START was allowed to settle early, came seven wide into the lane and closed the gap fast late. ECLIPTICALS BEAR set a pressured pace and was two to three wide on the turn, then dug in gamely in the drive but was outfinished. KAZ MUNNINGS chased the pace three wide, came six wide into the lane but had no kick, even effort. AMICALOLA FALLS tracked the early pace on the inside, then eased out on the turn and came five wide off the turn, then angled in to the rail and finished willingly but needed more. ON OUR WAY BOYZ pressed the early pace in between rivals, three to two wide on the turn, swung out five wide leaving the turn, then shifted in by the furlong marker and weakened. JUGGLER was off slow and never threatened. LARZ rushed up the inside to press the pace from the inside and then faltered the final quarter of a mile.

ENTRY.NAME: Juggler
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slowly, failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Larz
ENTRY.COMMENT: rushed up inside, pressed, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Amicalola Falls
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside, 5 wide upper, angled in, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Freedom's Start
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, came 7 wide upper stretch, closed gap,

ENTRY.NAME: Kaz Munnings
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace 3 wide, came 6 wide, no kick

ENTRY.NAME: Eclipticals Bear
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace, 2-3 wide turn, dug in, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: On Our Way Boyz
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace between horses, swung 5 wide, shift in, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Dr Rags
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted pace outside, bid 4 wide, long drive, edged clear

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Dark Hollow Farm, D. Brown, Davidov & Schwaber

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 87. Allowance Purse 28000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR PENNSYLVANIA BRED. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 22 Allowed 2 lb s. A Race Since October 22 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $16,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HOT FUDGE WARRIOR set the pacer while in the two path, then came three wide off the turn and kicked away by the furlong marker, then was kept to crop urging to prove best. STASSI stumbled at the start, recovered to stalk the winner three wide, then was sent down leaving the turn and finished willingly but could not get to the winner while holding on to the place award gamely. CUT FROM CLASS tracked the pace two wide, then was between rivals by the quarter pole, then ran on but was out-kicked for the place award. CHARM ALARM was settled early between rivals, swung out five wide leaving the turn and had a late rally. MONGOLIAN PANTHER tracked the pace three wide and came four wide off the turn but had no kick. CABRA CHICA was settled on the inside and saved ground on the turn, swung out three wide leaving the turn and had no rally. BUSTIN DOWN DOORS was bumped at the start, prompted the winner from the inside and weakened in the drive. EARLY FROST was settled early on the outside and was not a threat.

ENTRY.NAME: Bustin Down Doors
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, prompted pace inside, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Hot Fudge Warrior
ENTRY.OWNER: Two Ten Twelve Triple T Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace 2 wide, 3 wide upper stretch, kicked clear, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Cabra Chica
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, saved ground turn, swung 3 wide, no rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Charm Alarm
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled between horses, swung 5 wide, late rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Cut From Class
ENTRY.OWNER: Keil Steven D and Keil Caitlin
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace 2 wide, between 1/4, outfinished place

ENTRY.NAME: Stassi
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled start, stalked pace 3 wide, willingly, held 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Mongolian Panther
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace 3 wide, came 4 wide, no kick

ENTRY.NAME: Early Frost
ENTRY.OWNER: IBB Thoroughbred and Stem Brandon Paul
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled outside, no threat,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 59. Maiden Claiming Purse 17000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, if for $14,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ROBO WARRIOR prompted the early pace three wide, made a two wide bid on the turn to take over nearing the quarter pole, then lugged in slightly by the three sixteenths, then was corrected and kicked away in the furlong grounds to prove best under left handed crop urging. BROKENHEARTED was well placed early towards the inside, made a three wide bid by the quarter pole to loom boldly off the turn, but flattened out the final furlong, held place award. CALL ME NOW was settled early, three wide by the quarter pole and came four wide off the turn and had a late rally. SPORTING THE GOLD set the pace from the inside and then dueled for the lead on the turn, weakened in the drive. SUPER JO bobbled at the start, then recovered and chased the pace on the outside, then was three wide on the turn and stopped.

ENTRY.NAME: Sporting the Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace inside, dueled turn, weakened stretch,

ENTRY.NAME: Call Me Now
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, 3 wide 1/4 pole, came 4 wide, late rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Brokenhearted
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed inside, bid 3 wide, flattened out, held 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Super Jo
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled start, chased 4-3 wide, stopped

ENTRY.NAME: Robo Warrior
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted pace 3 wide, bid 2 wide, lug in 3/16, drew clear,driving

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 64. Claiming Purse 10800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 22 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MONEY MAKING KAZ dueled for the lead on the outside, made a two wide bid leaving the furlong marker and drew clear to prove best under a drive. HE IS BAD dueled for the lead on the inside but could not go with the winner late, second best. WICKED IRISHMAN chased the pace two wide early, two to three wide on the turn, then lacked the needed closing bid while gaining the show award. SPELLED WELL chased the early pace in between rivals, then came four wide into the lane but lacked the needed closing bid while being out-kicked for the show award. OVER THE BORDER chased the early pace on the outside, dropped back on the turn, three wide by the quarter pole, shifted in and had a mild late gain. BRANTLEYS BIG GUN tracked the early pace on the inside, shuffled back on the turn, then stayed on the inside and faded. BUMBLE MONSTER broke in the air at the start, then advanced on the inside on the turn, two wide by the quarter pole and then weakened. LOOKIN BACK LUCKY failed to menace. LYFE IS SIMPLE was not a factror.

ENTRY.NAME: Lookin Back Lucky
ENTRY.COMMENT: failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Lyfe Is Simple
ENTRY.COMMENT: no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Brantleys Big Gun
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace inside, shuffled back turn, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Bumble Monster
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in air, inside turn, 2 wide 1/4 pole, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Wicked Irishman
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace, 2-3 wide turn, needed bid, got 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Spelled Well
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased between horses, came 4 wide, out-kicked 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: He Is Bad
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled inside, no match late, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Money Making Kaz
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled outside, bid 2 wide, drew clear, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Over the Border
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased outside, 3 wide 1/4 pole, shift in, mild kick

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 67. Claiming Purse 10000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JUNE 22. Three Year Olds, 123 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GOLDEN EIB MICRPHN set the early pace and then drew off in the lane and was ridden out to prove much the best. DAILY BRIEFING stalked the winner three wide and proved to be no match for that rival while saving the place award. RISQUE'S JEWEL was reserved early, came five wide into the lane and had a belated rally to just miss the place award. HALLIGIRL was settled early, made a mild bid on the turn but flattened out. MELODIA was well placed early two wide and weakened. CARLY HUSTLE chased the early pace on the inside and stopped.

ENTRY.NAME: Carly Hustle
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace inside, stopped

ENTRY.NAME: Risque's Jewel
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved early, came 5 wide, belatedly, missed 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Halligirl
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, advanced turn, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: Golden Eib Micrphn
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace inside, drew off, ridden out,

ENTRY.NAME: Melodia
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed 2 wide, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Daily Briefing
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace 3 wide, no match, saved place
